Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Marion-Arsinoe, Necropolis II, tomb CXVI
Curator's comments: It is difficult to precisely date alabastra of this kind by form alone, either the exports from Egypt or ones made in local gypsum. but they were probably made and used between the seventh and the fourth centuries BC. Chavane 1990 (77ff.) provides a survey of findspots around Cyprus and further afield in the context of examples from modern tomb excavations at Amathus. Bibliography: Chavane, Marie-José 1990, La nécropole d’Amathonte. Tombs 110-385. IV. Les petits objects. Études Chypriotes XII (Nicosia: Department of Antiquities; French School at Athens).
